meanings.definition: Relating to the study of periodic biological phenomena in relation to climate.
meanings.sent1: The researchers observed the phenologically linked patterns in plant growth.
meanings.sent2: The flowers bloomed phenologically, following the changing weather.
meanings.sent3: The phenologically timed migration of birds always amazed the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her phenologically accurate predictions about the weather were impressive.
meanings.sent5: The phenologically synchronized dance of fireflies lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is characteristic of the timing of natural events.
meanings.sent1: The birds chirped phenologically as the sun rose.
meanings.sent2: The leaves changed color phenologically with the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent3: She always arrived phenologically late to the party, adding to her mysterious aura.
meanings.sent4: The news spread phenologically fast throughout the small town.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed phenologically, reflecting the changing seasons.

meanings.definition: The study of the timing of biological events in relation to seasonal changes.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pursue phenology to understand the phenologically linked cycles of nature.
meanings.sent2: The field of phenology focuses on observing phenologically related occurrences in the environment.
meanings.sent3: The phenologically curious child asked endless questions about the changing seasons.
meanings.sent4: In the world of phenology, researchers track phenologically significant events.
meanings.sent5: The book on phenology explained the importance of phenologically studying plant behavior.
